content.title: Mukhya Mantri Sharmik Surksha Yojana- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhya Mantri Sharmik Surksha Yojana' is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB). Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- will be provided to the widows/dependents of workers employed in industrial and commercial institutions in Haryana, in the event of the worker's death while working at the workplace.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- to the widows/dependents of workers in the event of the worker's death while working at the workplace.
eligibility: The applicant should be the widow/dependent of the deceased worker.
The deceased worker should have been employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
There is no fixed service period required for the worker.
There is no fixed monthly salary requirement for the worker.
Applications must be submitted within two years from the date of the worker's death.
Financial assistance is provided for deaths primarily caused by workplace incidents or on the way to the hospital for treatment.
Assistance is also provided to widows/dependents of unregistered workers who die or become disabled due to incidents within the establishment.
content.application_process: Online application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: Smart Card /Office ID Proof of worker
Affidavit (fully dependent upon the deceased worker)

faqs.question: What benefit does the scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,00,000/- to the widows/dependents of workers in the event of the worker's death while working at the workplace.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows or dependents of workers employed in industrial or commercial establishments in Haryana are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Does the worker need to be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board?
Is there any service period requirement for the deceased worker?
faqs.answer: No, there is no fixed service period required.

faqs.question: Is there a fixed monthly salary requirement for the deceased worker?
faqs.answer: No, there is no fixed monthly salary requirement for the deceased worker.

faqs.question: Within what time frame must the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications must be submitted within two years from the date of the worker's death.

faqs.question: What types of deaths are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Deaths caused by workplace incidents, natural disasters, heart attacks, poisonous creature bites, fire, or building collapses within the organization are covered.

faqs.question: Are deaths during commuting to the hospital for treatment covered?
faqs.answer: Yes, deaths on the way to the hospital for treatment are covered.

faqs.question: How can applicants apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal: https://saralharyana.gov.in/
